content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a man named Peter Schmidt from Germany.
name: Emilia Müller

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of this conversation was the rental price of a newly built unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center of Duisburg.
name: Emilia Müller

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why did you not agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: The reason we did not agree on a final price was because the landlord, Peter Schmidt, insisted on getting the highest possible price for the apartment. He did not accept my offer of €1,300 per month and requested another offer from me.
name: Emilia Müller

content: If yes, what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I did not reach a final agreement with the landlord. The highest price I offered was €1,300 per month, but the landlord, Peter Schmidt, was still looking for a higher price.
name: Emilia Müller

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner, Peter Schmidt, as a 3. The negotiation process was quite difficult due to his insistence on receiving the highest possible price, and he did not seem to appreciate the fair offers I provided.
name: Emilia Müller

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator
